text: Al Aqsa TV () is a television station run by the Palestinian political group Hamas, which is from the Gaza Strip. The television station broadcasts news, promotional material for Hamas, cartoons (such as Tomorrow's Pioneers which promoted Anti-Zionism and violence against Israel and USA), and religious programs. The television station's current director is Fathi Ahmad, who holds membership to the Palestinian Legislative Council, and is the Interior Minster of the Gaza Strip. The station is named after the Al-Aqsa compound in Jerusalem. == References == Category:Palestine Category:Television stations Category:Hamas
title: Al-Aqsa TV
